Manjunath Omana Kuttan

Research Experience

Postdoctoral Researcher

Institution: Frankfurt Institute for Advanced Studies (FIAS), Germany

2023 – current | Working group (Deepthinkers): Dr. Jan Steinheimer, Prof. Dr. Kai Zhou


Currently involved in research focusing on AI for fast simulations of scientific data as a member of the KISS collaboration
BMBF project: Künstliche Intelligenz zur Schnellen Simulation von wissenschaftlichen Daten.


For the first time, deep generative methods are employed for accurate and ultra fast generation of heavy-ion collisions events. This includes autoregressive pointcloud generation, diffusion pointclouds etc. which generates events in the form of a pointcloud of various particle species in momentum space.


Drafts under preparation:

  • Accelerating simulations of heavy-ion collisions with deep generative models for next generation experiments.
  • Ultra-fast event-by-event simulation of heavy-ion collisions through pointcloud diffusion.

Doctoral Research

2019 – 2023 | Advisor: Prof. Dr. Dr. h.c. mult. Horst Stoecker

Institution: Goethe University, Germany

Advanced AI methods were developed to transcend the limitations of conventional techniques used to infer the underlying physics governing the dense nuclear matter created in heavy-ion collisions. The research involved several innovative solutions:

  • Bayesian constraints on the high-density QCD Equation of State (EoS).
  • Accurate, online event-by-event centrality meter for CBM experiment.
  • Dynamical time evolution in transport and fluid dynamical models.
  • DL for identifying first-order phase transitions at CBM experiment.
  • Uncertainties in MC-Glauber modeling at SIS-18 energies.
  • DL for noise cluster filtering (online) in CERN-NA61 experiment.
  • PointNet based determination of number of participant nucleons in HADES@SIS-18 and STAR@RHIC experiments.

Other Activities:

  • Mentor for Master’s students (AI-analysis for PANDA & NA61 experiments).
  • Local organizer for MAGIC23: Workshop on QCD EoS in dense matter HIC & Astrophysics, Kovalam, India.
  • Local organizer: XF-ĲRC AI4Science workshop, Frankfurt am Main, Germany.

Master’s Research

2018 – 2019 | Advisor: Prof. Dr. Deepak Samuel

Institution: Central University of Karnataka, India

A Deep Learning (DL) based algorithm was developed to reconstruct the muon momentum in the ICAL detector, which studies neutrino oscillations at the India-based Neutrino Observatory (INO). The detector was simulated in Geant4 to generater the training data for the neural network. The algorithm's performance was evaluated in terms of accuracy and computational efficiency.

Summer Intern

2018 | Institution: India-based Neutrino Observatory (IICHEP)

Activities included:

  • Fabrication of Resistive Plate Chambers (RPCs).
  • Setting up test experiments for RPCs and installation of mini-ICAL detector.
  • Data analysis of cosmic muon data at Tata Institute of Fundamental Research (TIFR) field station, Madurai.
